intro: Alyxia suavis, commonly known as sweet alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. Its showy, fragrant flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent tube shape. Alyxia suavis is often found in moist, open habitats such as swamps and pine flatwoods.
